comment_0:
Great song.  This guy's music is really growing on me.

About the song, it's pretty self-explainitory.  He's singing about his new life, and how good he feels.  Maybe a life-changing type thing. Nothings keeping him down.  He has the world to explore.
comment_1:
Hah, oh, me, too. We've got this on our new in-store DVD on rotation, and it's just great.

But is it just me, but is this clearly more Bond-inspired than 'Man From U.N.C.L.E.' ? Hell, if they'd do it, this would be a great bit to put into the newest flick.
comment_2:
:dies:

Oh, lord, help me. But I just thought of this: is this not an excellent theme to put in the back of one of those damned 'new medication will change your life' adverts? 
:snirk:

"It's a new dawn, it's a new day, it's a new liiiiiiife. And I'm feeeeling ... gooooooood!"

Man, I really can see it now. Let the countdown to the marketing commence.
comment_3: The Muse version of this song (which is good!) was knocked off by an ad company for a coffee commercial when the band wouldn't agree to let them use it, so your fears have been realized in a way.
comment_4: Actually, this song is already being used for commercials by ESPN (with permission) for the 2005 World Series of Poker.  I personally feel that fits, as it has that sound of the old Vegas era a la Sinatra.
comment_5: I thought that this song was about the start of a new relationship.  It's just simply saying that he's just told her how he feels and so now he has nothing to hide, and he's feeling alot better now.
comment_6: Well, it doesn't look like anyone is aware that this is not an original song by BublÃ©. This song was originally sung by Nina Simone in the 60s and I highly suggest you listen to it! Michael BublÃ© does a nice job covering it, but no one can sing it like Nina.
comment_7:
Nina Simone's version of the song is great, but not comparable to Michael Buble's version. They are both good in their seperate ways. 
I would have to agree with lilybear on the meaning. I suppose you could apply the meaning of this song however you want. It is very braud. Perhaps he has had a life changing experiance, perhaps he is in love, perhaps being in love is a life changing experiance for him. Regardless, this song just makes you feel good; it's easy to get into the groove of the beat, and the way he sings it is just catchy. Exactly what every good song should do.
comment_8: I love this song, it sounds like something on 007
comment_9:
anyone know any versions besides this one, the muse noe and Nina Simone's??

I heard this song in an ad (not coffee) you see and i have been searching for it...
comment_10: Nina Simone didn't sing a "version" of this song. It's her song. Muse and Michael Buble sang versions of it. Give her the credit deserves, she's an amazing soul singer, no one can a song better than the original.
comment_11:
Michale Buble has nothing on Nina Simone when it comes to this song.

Nina owns when it comes to who sings it better but I still LOVE Michael Buble.  He's a great alternative to today's pretentious artists.
comment_12: Traffic also recorded this song, and is on their "Last Exit" album released in 1969.
comment_13: if Michael hadnt coverd it we wouldnt know it. Everybody loves the  21st century Swing King. dont deny it
comment_14: and he did a great job covering
comment_15: god i love this cover.  he did an amazingg job.
comment_16:
Nina Simone didn't sing a "version" of this song. It's her song."


ummm...original version??? Its still a version to me.
comment_17: what's funny is that Nina Simone was not the original singer/composer of this song either. amazing song either way.
comment_18: did you see the clips of the song? Muse and Michael use the same signs : feeling good speaks probably about freedom after comunism. Muse has CCCCP on their T-Shirt, and Michael uses the octopus, who was a metaphore of comunism during the cold war. then, feeling good because we are free from comunism
comment_19:
Nina Simone wasn't the original artist to perform this song. It was actually written for a musical, but Simone was the first one to really make it famous. 

I think the song can be taken in many different ways. From actually celebrating freedom, to be completely happy about something.
comment_20:
Muse cover is my favourite version, it's beautiful.
I think this song is about doing something new, something different... 
"It's a new dawn, it's a new day, it's a new life for me and I'm feeling good."

New doesn't mean bad. : )
comment_21:
this is what music really is...not just the beat that most of the songs have right now.
Lyrically great and the voice too...shoot!
comment_22: For me, this song is very sexy. The singer is very smug about why he/she feels good, he addresses inanimate objects, such as pine trees, rivers and stars and tells them they know he/she feels good, almost tauntingly as if it's a big secret that he or she isn't supposed to tell, which makes me come to the conclusion that the singer has just gotten laid, feels smug and wants the world to know about it!
comment_23: My thought of what this song is about that he broke free of a relationship and hes feeling good to be free.. but thats my point of view.... on the other hand I absolutely amazing AMAZING!!!!!! =)
comment_24: I love Adam Lamberts cover of this song(: this sing has got to be one of my favorites.
comment_25:
Awh, now this song is a killer. An absolute killer. You can just feel the ecstatic freedom in Michael Buble's booming voice. 
It's pretty obvious that the meaning of the song is one of pure joy and smug freedom. I knew it wasn't Buble's song originally, but I admit I haven't heard Nina Simone's version. I should look that up sometime. Still, Buble's version is just so completely powerful in that soaring big band way. Adore it! x)

This will always be my favourite song to sing in the shower. "Aaan' I'm feeelin....GOOOOD!" =D

(BTW, just to clear it up, this was written by Anthony Newley and Leslie Bricusse for the 1965 musical "The Roar of the Greasepaintâthe Smell of the Crowd" starring Cy Grant, who originally sang this song.)
comment_26:
To me, this song is an amazing emotion that a man hasn't felt for quite a long time! Unfortunately, this man is married and refuses to divorce his wife as he hates for his 5 year old son to grow with separated parents.
However, this long time not felt sense is easing the pressure of him and helping him stand the shitty day to day routine at home and work. Yet, he doesn't wanna commit the beautiful and amazing angel he was blessed with into any relation as the age difference is big and this angel has a beautiful life before her! He is willing to do absolutely anything to this angel as a reward for her giving him this passion again to life.... this giving might even be a piece of advise with the person this angel might be in a relation with... and this might of course kill him every day until his last day!
The catch here is to enjoy the journey and care less for the result. It's gonna come anyway. Why bother now... Just enjoy the journey!
